resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
romainfrancois commented on a change in pull request #2978: ARROW-3804: [R] Support older versions of R runtime
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2978#discussion_r234118972
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/DESCRIPTION
 ##########
 @@ -7,7 +7,7 @@ Authors@R: c(
     person("Apache Arrow", email = "dev@arrow.apache.org", role = c("aut", "cph"))
   )
 Description: R Integration to 'Apache' 'Arrow'.
-Depends: R (>= 3.5)
+Depends: R (>= 3.1)
 
 Review comment:
   This was a way to eventually be able to use ALTREP without resorting to conditional compilation. If we support older versions of R, this needs to be tested too. Can you also amend the travis config ?

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

javierluraschi commented on a change in pull request #2978: ARROW-3804: [R] Support older versions of R runtime
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2978#discussion_r234370685
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/DESCRIPTION
 ##########
 @@ -7,7 +7,7 @@ Authors@R: c(
     person("Apache Arrow", email = "dev@arrow.apache.org", role = c("aut", "cph"))
   )
 Description: R Integration to 'Apache' 'Arrow'.
-Depends: R (>= 3.5)
+Depends: R (>= 3.1)
 
 Review comment:
   Yes for sure, good point. Well, definitely if `ALTREP` ends up working out as expected, etc. we can reconsider, but at least for now, it would help to lower the version. To give you more background, a bunch of scripts in Spark rely on older versions of R, while it's possible to upgrade those clusters, it adds overhead that would be nice to avoid at least while we can.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

romainfrancois commented on a change in pull request #2978: ARROW-3804: [R] Support older versions of R runtime
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2978#discussion_r238557220
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .travis.yml
 ##########
 @@ -303,6 +303,7 @@ matrix:
     - bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash) || echo "Codecov did not collect coverage reports"
   # R
   - language: r
+    r: 3.1
 
 Review comment:
   I don't like to only be testing in very old versions. I understand the need to support it, but this does not protect us from changes in R. 
   
   Plus if we start to play with newer features, carefully protected by conditional compiling or whatever, this will never be tested. 
   
   But I don't know if it's cool to test on various versions of R as we typically do, e.g. https://github.com/tidyverse/dplyr/blob/master/.travis.yml#L10

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

romainfrancois commented on a change in pull request #2978: ARROW-3804: [R] Support older versions of R runtime
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2978#discussion_r238557220
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .travis.yml
 ##########
 @@ -303,6 +303,7 @@ matrix:
     - bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash) || echo "Codecov did not collect coverage reports"
   # R
   - language: r
+    r: 3.1
 
 Review comment:
   I don't like to **only** be testing in very old versions. I understand the need to support it, but this does not protect us from changes in R. 
   
   Plus if we start to play with newer features, carefully protected by conditional compiling or whatever, this will never be tested. 
   
   But I don't know if it's cool to test on various versions of R as we typically do, e.g. https://github.com/tidyverse/dplyr/blob/master/.travis.yml#L10

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

romainfrancois commented on issue #2978: ARROW-3804: [R] Support older versions of R runtime
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2978#issuecomment-453005138
 
 
   I'm good with lowering the required R, but then we need to be testing all versions we support. 
   
   Typically it means expanding the travis build matrix,; e.g. in dplyr: https://github.com/tidyverse/dplyr/blob/master/.travis.yml#L11

romainfrancois commented on issue #2978: ARROW-3804: [R] Support older versions of R runtime
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2978#issuecomment-478001876
 
 
   I have modified this so that: 
   - in the DESCRIPTION we express that this is supported for R >= 3.1
   - but on Travis testing it against released R
   
   At some point we'll need to figure out a better strategy for testing the R package against various versions of R, supported platforms, etc ...

fields.description: Currently R 3.5 is required but 3.1 only needed by functionality and dependencies.
